name: Salles Hotel Pere IV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Pere IV Hotel for 5 nights of our Honey moon. The hotel pampered us with wonderfull room, teasty breakfast, helpfull stuff and great attitude. Pere IV is located just 3 minutes walk from the yellow line of the metro in a quiet location. Near by can be found many little restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Great Honey moon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't ask for more.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in this Hotel for a week in July. We looked at the reviews on Tripadvisor, and found a good price to stay at the hotel. It was an immaculately presented hotel and the staff were really helpful. Yes it was a little out of the way, but there is a Metro station very close and if you like to walk, then it isn't so bad at all! Our room was on the 7th Floor and it was really nice. The bathroom was very large and had a good powerful shower, it was always clean and was really nice. The bed was comfortable and was made up everyday. There was a large wardrobe and plenty of space for all of your clothes. The view isn't spectacular, but we weren't in the room enough to mind.
reviews.title: Pere is excellent

reviews.text: The pool isn't anything special, but it is a nice extra after a long day sightseeing. And the beach isn't far away at all.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a very nice hotel and i would reccomend it if you can get a good price on it, as it is a little out of the way. Barcelona is a beautiful city. And any football fans have to go to Nou Camp.
reviews.title: A Fine Establishment!

likes.disliked: — 2 single beds in a double room!

reviews.text: Very good hotel, only a few stops from Ramblas, so worth paying the reduced rate compared to more central hotels. Excellent breakfast, was 12 euro pp, not included in our hotel rate. Staff went out of their way to accomodate our 1 year old baby, arranged a cot in bedroom.
reviews.title: Overall good hotel with one exception
Pere Review
reviews.text: Negatives were that even though we went in winter, rooms were hot and this was without any heating on, we had to switch on the aircon to cool our room. Our room was facing a road with all the bars on, and it was very noisy. This seems to be a problem on Saturday nights only when they open until 5am. Music, cars and people all contributed to this noise. So request a room at the front of the hotel if you a light sleeper.

reviews.title: Welcoming and Friendly
reviews.text: Overall, recommended but request a room at the front of hotel.

reviews.title: Great Hotel. No problem with the neighbourhood

reviews.text: This is a decent quality, modern hotel which will appeal to those who are on a budget, but still like comfort and quality, and if the location is an area for compromise.
reviews.title: VERY nice hotel in smelly, untidy neighbourhood

reviews.text: Ive just returned from a 4 day break in this hotel. The hotel was great, the service from I checked in until I checked out was brillant and the staff couldn't have been more helpfull. Dave on the reception was great giving me lots of tourist information from what to see to where to eat and warnings about pickpockets. I had e-mailed the hotel before I arrived to get information on getting from Sants bus station to the hotel and they got back to me quite quickly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities in the hotel was excellent, the pool and gym area was abit small but there wasnt many guests using them so it was ok. My room was lovely, the bathroom was quite spacious, the bedroom was on the small side but it was a single room and there was a balcony with a table and chairs which was lovely. The food in the restaurant was quite good but the menu was very limited. The breakfast was great a good choice of breads, fruits, cereals and fried foods etc.
reviews.title: Very good

Having read some of the reviews on trip advisor I was abit anxious about the area as I was travelling alone but I found that it was quite safe and there was lots of bars and restaurants nearby so I didnt have to go to far.

reviews.text: We loved our two week stay at Pere IV!!! I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona. It was very close to the metro stop, Bogatell. There were many small restaurants in the local area, one great one on the same block, who sold fantastic potatoes with garlic mayonaise. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Everyone was so friendly and kind. The rooms were well kept and decorarted well. I must say i loved breakfast, I could never miss it, it was the highlight of each morning. The variety of breads, fruits, eggs, drinks, and pastrys were to die for. When I go back to Barcelona, I am staying at Pere IV again!!!
reviews.title: Loved Pere IV

likes.liked: — clean, affordable, close to metro, internet access

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel with our three children. We were very impressed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. The children loved the pool and the gym. We didn't feel threatened at all by the area. It is obvious that the whole area is undergoing a huge regeneration and is on its way up. We walked back from the metro several times after midnight and never felt in any way threatened. We had a couple of excellent meals in the restaurant and will be visiting this hotel again as we loved Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: For the most part, the reviews written here are very accurate. The hotel is very nice and the staff very helpful. The Bogatell Metro stop is a couple of blocks away and very convenient to the places we wanted to go. If you don't want to be in the center of activity with the attendant hustle and bustle, and you don't mind stepping around the dog do-do on the sidewalk and the less than attractive neighborhood, this hotel might be for you. It's a question of trade-offs, budget and how fussy you are about the area you stay in. I liked it better than two other Barcelona hotels we have stayed in, but my wife would have preferred a different neighborhood.

Good hotel, bad location. Stay in Gothic quarter!
reviews.text: The Pere IV is nicely decorated and the staff is very professional. They took endless pains to accommodate my wife and baby daughter, who had come along at the last minute, and they managed to put us in an excellent room on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the city...even though it was a very busy weekend due to Formula I races. There is a superb restaurant on the ground floor.

Although the Pere IV is about two blocks from the metro, it is about 10 blocks from anything interesting by walking. In contrast, when we moved to a hotel in the Gothic Quarter near Las Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, and the waterfront, that area is incredibly vibrant and exciting, with restaurants and little shops lining all the streets and alleys. If you had been to Barcelona, you wouldn't even be considering the Pere IV because you know how great those other areas are.
reviews.title: Great for the weekend

description: Pere IV is situated in the Poble Nou District, 10 minutes’ walk from the lively Port Olimpic area and Barcelona's beaches. This hotel features spa, indoor pool and free Wi-Fi access.Each of the spacious rooms comes with a free welcome minibar. All rooms have a flat-screen TV, with satellite channels. The a la carte Garum Restaurant offers Mediterranean cuisine. The hotel serves a daily, buffet breakfast. The Pere IV's spa includes a sauna, sensation showers, a Turkish bath and a hot tub. There is also a 24-hour reception. The Pere IV is a short walk from the beach and the new marina. Nearby Bogatell Metro Station offers easy access to the beach and the city centre, which can both be reached within 15 minutes.
